HDG.LOG.content: thinking changes the world, changes world in ever darker depths of a riddle (Rätsel) > riddle propounded (zugesagt) to us [for a long time] in word “Being” > Being remains only the provisional (vorläufige) word [Being originally called “presencing (Anwesen),” enduring-here-before in unconcealment (her-vor-währen in die Unverborgenheit)] [truth and security, Wahrheit]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: thinking changes the world, changes world in ever darker depths of a riddle (Rätsel) > riddle propounded (zugesagt) to us [for a long time] in word “Being” > Being remains only the provisional (vorläufige) word [Being originally called “presencing (Anwesen),” enduring-here-before in unconcealment (her-vor-währen in die Unverborgenheit)] [truth and security, Wahrheit]

HDG.IM.content: German idealism didn’t collapse, age wasn’t great enough to stand up to greatness, breadth, originality of spiritual world, to realize it (more than apply propositions/insights) > Dasein began to lack depth (from which essential comes/returns to human beings), a leveling, no more rank (a blind mirror that no longer mirrors) [w/out rank, can’t stand up to greatness of spirit, but what about the greatness of killing that spirit? (e.g. Nietzsche)]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: German idealism didn’t collapse, age wasn’t great enough to stand up to greatness, breadth, originality of spiritual world, to realize it (more than apply propositions/insights) > Dasein began to lack depth (from which essential comes/returns to human beings), a leveling, no more rank (a blind mirror that no longer mirrors) [w/out rank, can’t stand up to greatness of spirit, but what about the greatness of killing that spirit? (e.g. Nietzsche)]

HDG.BC.content: “Will to Power,” all human planning a great “game,” “world-play,” a world coming out of joint
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “Will to Power,” all human planning a great “game,” “world-play,” a world coming out of joint

HDG.BC.content: convulsion of entire world pessimism > for genuine passion of sobriety [Kierkegaard’s GEST]: best optimism too lame, every pessimism too blind
HDG.BC.linkedContent: convulsion of entire world pessimism > for genuine passion of sobriety [Kierkegaard’s GEST]: best optimism too lame, every pessimism too blind

HDG.LA.content: difference for world/thing disclosingly appropriates things into being a world
HDG.LA.linkedContent: difference for world/thing disclosingly appropriates things into being a world

HDG.LA.content: [overdetermined difference?] dif-ference stills in a twofold manner, still by letting things rest in world’s favor
HDG.LA.linkedContent: [overdetermined difference?] dif-ference stills in a twofold manner, still by letting things rest in world’s favor

HDG.IWM.content: at stake: attentiveness (Achten) to arrival (Ankunft) of hitherto unspoken essence of unconcealedness Being has announced (angekündigt) itself to be [cf. 280n X Being, also Being, truth, world, Ereignis] [multiple names]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: at stake: attentiveness (Achten) to arrival (Ankunft) of hitherto unspoken essence of unconcealedness Being has announced (angekündigt) itself to be [cf. 280n X Being, also Being, truth, world, Ereignis] [multiple names]

HDG.QB.content: catastrophes? 2 world wars didn’t halt movement of nihilism
HDG.QB.linkedContent: catastrophes? 2 world wars didn’t halt movement of nihilism

HDG.QB.content: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

HDG.FS.content: [technological era] represent world in sequence of its appearances so I can make secure predictions about all/everything
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [technological era] represent world in sequence of its appearances so I can make secure predictions about all/everything

HDG.FS.content: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events
HDG.FS.linkedContent: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation
HDG.FS.linkedContent: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: when Heidegger first attempts to exit prison of consciousness (in Being and Time), not restoring realism against idealism: realism (assurance a world exists for subject) dependent on Cartesianism [Heidegger attempting to think Greek sense of egō]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when Heidegger first attempts to exit prison of consciousness (in Being and Time), not restoring realism against idealism: realism (assurance a world exists for subject) dependent on Cartesianism [Heidegger attempting to think Greek sense of egō]

HDG.FS.content: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth
HDG.FS.linkedContent: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth

HDG.FS.content: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)

HDG.FS.content: limit of body is skin, limit of “lived-body” more difficult to determine, not “world” > only world where there’s language, i.e. understanding of being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: limit of body is skin, limit of “lived-body” more difficult to determine, not “world” > only world where there’s language, i.e. understanding of being

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”

HDG.FS.content: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)

HDG.FS.content: subjectivity itself not questioned re: its being > since Descartes, subjectivity is fundamentum inconcussum, the barrier to unfolding Seinsfrage ——the “making-present-to-oneself (Selbstvergegenwärtigung)” of consciousness takes place in immanence, what I am conscious of is present to me, in my consciousness > in Being and Time, “thing” no longer in consciousness, but in the world > despite intentionality, Husserl remains trapped in immanence: Husserl retrieves proper consistency of object, saves object, but by situating it in immanence of consciousness
HDG.FS.linkedContent: subjectivity itself not questioned re: its being > since Descartes, subjectivity is fundamentum inconcussum, the barrier to unfolding Seinsfrage ——the “making-present-to-oneself (Selbstvergegenwärtigung)” of consciousness takes place in immanence, what I am conscious of is present to me, in my consciousness > in Being and Time, “thing” no longer in consciousness, but in the world > despite intentionality, Husserl remains trapped in immanence: Husserl retrieves proper consistency of object, saves object, but by situating it in immanence of consciousness

HDG.MA.content: if hydrogen bombs don’t explode, uncanny change in world moves upon us > what is most uncanny: (not technical advance itself) being unprepared for transformation, inability to confront what’s dawning meditatively
HDG.MA.linkedContent: if hydrogen bombs don’t explode, uncanny change in world moves upon us > what is most uncanny: (not technical advance itself) being unprepared for transformation, inability to confront what’s dawning meditatively

HDG.MA.content: meaning pervading technology hides itself > heed that this hidden meaning touches us everywhere (in world of technology), then we stand at once in realm that hides from us, hides in approaching us > essential trait of mystery (Geheimnis): shows itself & at same time withdraws
HDG.MA.linkedContent: meaning pervading technology hides itself > heed that this hidden meaning touches us everywhere (in world of technology), then we stand at once in realm that hides from us, hides in approaching us > essential trait of mystery (Geheimnis): shows itself & at same time withdraws

HDG.LP.content: since Plato, soul suprasensuous (Übersinnlichen), if it appears in sensible world, does so as a castaway (verschlagen) > on Earth, soul doesn’t have the right cast (rechten Schlag), doesn’t belong, is something strange (ein Fremdes) [body is soul’s prison]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: since Plato, soul suprasensuous (Übersinnlichen), if it appears in sensible world, does so as a castaway (verschlagen) > on Earth, soul doesn’t have the right cast (rechten Schlag), doesn’t belong, is something strange (ein Fremdes) [body is soul’s prison]

HDG.LP.content: is [all] this dreamy romanticism of modern world (technology, economics) or clear knowledge of “madman”? he who sees more than what’s in the latest news, the current happenings [social media]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: is [all] this dreamy romanticism of modern world (technology, economics) or clear knowledge of “madman”? he who sees more than what’s in the latest news, the current happenings [social media]

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself

HDG.WL.content: to reflect on language qua language, abandon traditional procedure, no longer look for general notions (Vorstellungen) (energy, activity, labor, power of spirit, world view, expression) > explaining language by way of something else, running away (wegzuflüchten) from it > “the way to language intends to let language be experienced as language”
HDG.WL.linkedContent: to reflect on language qua language, abandon traditional procedure, no longer look for general notions (Vorstellungen) (energy, activity, labor, power of spirit, world view, expression) > explaining language by way of something else, running away (wegzuflüchten) from it > “the way to language intends to let language be experienced as language”

HDG.EC.content: could be that morality, w/ its visions of world order, is a monstrous offspring (Ausgeburt) of evil, & the much-appealed-to (vielberufene) Weltöffentlichkeit (word’s general public) remains in essence a construct (Gebild) and product (Erzeugnis) of devastation
HDG.EC.linkedContent: could be that morality, w/ its visions of world order, is a monstrous offspring (Ausgeburt) of evil, & the much-appealed-to (vielberufene) Weltöffentlichkeit (word’s general public) remains in essence a construct (Gebild) and product (Erzeugnis) of devastation

HDG.EC.content: World War only consequence of devastation [ontological history]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: World War only consequence of devastation [ontological history]

HDG.EC.content: devastation (Verwüstung): everything (human, world, earth) will transform into desert (Wüste) > desert is already there, doesn’t accumulate little by little, is there in an instant (Nu), in order to draw everything to it, to desert-ify (ver-wüsten)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: devastation (Verwüstung): everything (human, world, earth) will transform into desert (Wüste) > desert is already there, doesn’t accumulate little by little, is there in an instant (Nu), in order to draw everything to it, to desert-ify (ver-wüsten)

HDG.EC.content: malice of devastation reaches its extreme in appearance of secure state world, standard of living and its realization as highest goal [reaches its extreme in disguise]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: malice of devastation reaches its extreme in appearance of secure state world, standard of living and its realization as highest goal [reaches its extreme in disguise]

HDG.EC.content: morally grounded world order will not ward off (gebannt) or end process of devastation > no matter the measures man takes, malice may remain Grundzug of Being
HDG.EC.linkedContent: morally grounded world order will not ward off (gebannt) or end process of devastation > no matter the measures man takes, malice may remain Grundzug of Being

HDG.EC.content: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)

HDG.OHF.content: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

HDG.OHF.content: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

HDG.OHF.content: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]

HDG.OHF.content: world as something we are concerned about/attend to (Besorgte), shows itself as the wherefrom, out of which, and on the basis of which factical life is lived (woraus das faktische Leben lebt)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: world as something we are concerned about/attend to (Besorgte), shows itself as the wherefrom, out of which, and on the basis of which factical life is lived (woraus das faktische Leben lebt)

HDG.OHF.content: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: need a straightforward presentation (schlichte Vergegenwärtigung) of what the world is being encountered as, corresponding to our forehaving, in the now & soon to come of the particular awhileness of average everydayness > the awhileness (Jeweilikgeit) is a circumscribed situation (umgrenzte Lage), circumscribed by the particular givens closest to us (jeweilges Zünachst) [Zünachst as both now and proximity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: need a straightforward presentation (schlichte Vergegenwärtigung) of what the world is being encountered as, corresponding to our forehaving, in the now & soon to come of the particular awhileness of average everydayness > the awhileness (Jeweilikgeit) is a circumscribed situation (umgrenzte Lage), circumscribed by the particular givens closest to us (jeweilges Zünachst) [Zünachst as both now and proximity?]

HDG.OHF.content: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]

HDG.OHF.content: “worldy (weltlich)” not as opposite of “in the mind” but: to be there as “world” > character of the being-there of this world can be terminologically designated significance: what constitutes the being of that which is there is its signifying, which is being encountered in a definite manner [signifying not something extra, added on]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “worldy (weltlich)” not as opposite of “in the mind” but: to be there as “world” > character of the being-there of this world can be terminologically designated significance: what constitutes the being of that which is there is its signifying, which is being encountered in a definite manner [signifying not something extra, added on]

HDG.OHF.content: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)

HDG.OHF.content: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)

HDG.OHF.content: [Spinoza-like?] all the regions of everyday analysis aren’t to be read over against each other, but as definite modes of world’s being-encountered, each a specific character of the round-about (Um-Charakter)[everything here is condensed]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Spinoza-like?] all the regions of everyday analysis aren’t to be read over against each other, but as definite modes of world’s being-encountered, each a specific character of the round-about (Um-Charakter)[everything here is condensed]

HDG.OHF.content: character of being of care: absorbed (aufgeht) in its temporalization/actualization (Vollzug) > going about everyday dealings has character of carefreeness (Sorglosigkeit), world appears straightforward, self-evident, care is asleep: possibility remains that distress (Bedrängnis) will break forth in world > [Heidegger now racing to explain how curiosity (cura-curiositas!) doesn’t do away w/ self-evidence but reinforces it, thus care of curiosity covers itself up] > phenomenon of care, a fundamental phenomenon > (“I must break off here”)
